sn12.10:1.1: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
sn12.10:1.2: ‘Alas, this world has fallen into trouble. It’s born, grows old, dies, passes away, and is reborn,
sn12.10:1.3: yet it doesn’t understand how to escape from this suffering, from old age and death.
sn12.10:1.4: Oh, when will an escape be found from this suffering, from old age and death?’
sn12.10:2.2: ‘When what exists is there old age and death? What is a condition for old age and death?’
sn12.10:2.3: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.10:2.4: ‘When rebirth exists there’s old age and death. Rebirth is a condition for old age and death.’
sn12.10:3.11: ‘When what exists are there choices? What is a condition for choices?’
sn12.10:3.12: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.10:3.13: ‘When ignorance exists there are choices. Ignorance is a condition for choices.’
sn12.10:4.1: And so, ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.10:4.2: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.10:4.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.10:4.4: ‘Origination, origination.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
sn12.10:5.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no old age and death? When what ceases do old age and death cease?’
sn12.10:5.3: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.10:5.4: ‘When rebirth doesn’t exist there’s no old age and death? When rebirth ceases, old age and death cease.’
sn12.10:6.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no rebirth? …
sn12.10:6.11: ‘When what doesn’t exist are there no choices? When what ceases do choices cease?’
sn12.10:6.12: Then, through proper attention, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.10:6.13: ‘When ignorance doesn’t exist there are no choices. When ignorance ceases, choices cease.’
sn12.10:7.1: And so, when ignorance ceases, choices cease.
sn12.10:7.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.10:7.4: ‘Cessation, cessation.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.”
